q: ahead. "Mr. Donald Rumsfeld 's claim that the abuse at Abu Ghraib was isolated and aberrational is demonstrably false," Jameel Jaffer , ACLU's deputy legal director, said in a written statement. Government documents show that the methods used at Abu Ghraib were the same ones Mr. Donald Rumsfeld approved, and that the abuse of prisoners in Defense Department custody was systemic.... This effort to rewrite history is shameful. Donald Rumsfeld 's office is not commenting on the book until its Tuesday release date. Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking. "In addition to creating the jobs of the future, clean energy benefits the U.S. economy by ultimately making energy costs more affordable for consumers- especially if their dollars stay in America," Sergio Marchionne said. Hydraulic hybrid vehicle technology is one more promising path worth pursuing in the effort to reduce our carbon footprint, and we are excited to partner with the EPA to push forward on this track. EPA's hydraulic hybrid technology, developed in the agency's lab in Ann Arbor is coming into use in large delivery and refuse trucks across the country. and broken communities. Michael Vick now talks to kids-kids growing up like he did-about the mistakes he made. Carolyn Kilborn of Maryland Votes for Animals thinks Michael Vick 's work is valuable, telling the Baltimore Sun: Kids... are more likely to listen to someone like Michael Vick . He can do a lot of good for troubled kids... He has the power to make a change in kids' hearts like few other people can. for No. 10-- Philadelphia's 10th straight loss. Chauncey Billups scored 31 points and Carmelo Anthony had 14 to help the Denver Nuggets spoil Allen Iverson 's return to Philadelphia with a 93-83 win over the 76ers on Monday night. I just felt like I was back home, Allen Iverson said. "It was deja vu. Just a real good feeling. The fans made it hard on me because they made me more nervous than I already was."
